description: From French aconit, from Latin aconītum, from Ancient Greek ἀκόνιτον (akóniton).

entries.meaning: The herb wolfsbane, or monkshood; any plant of the genus Aconitum, all the species of which are poisonous.
(toxicology) An extract or tincture obtained from Aconitum napellus, used as a poison and medicinally.
